intro: Brassica celerifolia, commonly known as fast-growing broccoli, is a member of the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its compact, leafy head that forms quickly, typically within 50 to 60 days from seed. The plant produces small, green flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in cool climates and requires well-drained soil for optimal growth. This variety is prized for its high nutritional value and adaptability to various growing conditions.
